page.title: 01Esholt and Thackley
page.content: There is little that is special about this area,one of the prettiest in West Yorkshire,but still close to urban squalour and sprawl.Its most famous son was{Professor Joseph Wright,}a pioneer linguist.The area is locally notorious for the{Esholt sewage works and their smell,and for the TV series {Emmerdale Farm.}Thackley is the only settlement of any size,the area serves as a lung for the many small towns which surround it.One{railway line through the area has already gone,and the other two are under threat.The {canal}survives only as a picturesque tourist route,where once it brought prosperity to the area.The{main road between Leeds and Airedale runs through Thackley,and may soon be bypassed.The area seems to be on the edge of things,it's quiet and peaceful and the inhabitants like it that way.
